Meta is dumping Facebook logins as its metaverse ID system

stories.text:
Hi HN,

Is there any prior work in psychology or AI on what the minimum requirements for the average person to recognize something as conscious are?

Like for example what additional features would a Roomba need in order to be viewed by the average person as conscious? Is it just that society needs to be told that the entity is conscious, does it need to demonstrate some amount of free will, do we need to recognize that it has some similar biological machinery to us? Does it differ between cultures?

Someone must have studied this, I just can’t find the right keywords to find it on google.
stories.title: Ask HN: Prior work on minimum features for a recognizable consciousness?

stories.text: Number of Ansible related posts is decreasing on HN, if one takes a look for the last month at least. I wonder if Ansible still a thing ? I know that k8s slowly kills it, however I think there is still some niche for it … Or even in the area of configuration management and server provisioning it is being replaced by something else?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is Ansible Still a Thing?
